senses.de: To stop something from happening or someone from doing something
senses.ex: Regular exercise can help prevent heart disease

Tips.title: Proactive Measures
Tips.description: Prevent often implies taking action before a potential problem arises.

Tips.title: Safety Focus
Tips.description: Use 'prevent' when discussing measures to ensure safety and avoid harm.
Tips.example: Wearing a seatbelt prevents many injuries in car accidents.

Tips.title: Not Just Stop
Tips.description: 'Prevent' is more than just stopping; it's about proactively avoiding future issues.
Tips.example: Studying regularly prevents last-minute exam stress.

senses.de: To make an event or action impossible
senses.ex: The security system prevented the theft

Tips.title: Absolute Barrier
Tips.description: Use 'prevent' for situations where an action is made completely impossible.
Tips.example: The storm prevented all flights from leaving the airport.

Tips.title: Strong Obstacles
Tips.description: Implies a strong force or measure has completely obstructed an action.
Tips.example: The law prevents selling alcohol to minors.

senses.de: To be a hindrance or obstacle to
senses.ex: His disability prevented him from pursuing a career in sports

Tips.title: Barrier to Progress
Tips.description: Often used when a person or thing is stopping another from advancing or succeeding.
Tips.example: Lack of experience prevented him from getting the job.

Tips.title: Personal Circumstances
Tips.description: Consider using 'prevent' to describe personal barriers or limitations.
Tips.example: His injury prevented him from playing in the final game.

Block.wordDefinition:
Block means to stop something from passing through or getting to a particular area. For example, a wall is blocking the view of the other side.

Block can also mean to obstruct someone from achieving what they want, for example, the opposition blocked the bill from passing.

Prevent can also mean to take necessary measures to keep something from happening by making it difficult, for example, the police prevented riots by blocking the roads to the affected area.

Block stops something from going through or getting to a place while prevent stops something from happening.

Counteract.wordDefinition:
Counteract means to counter or neutralize the effects or consequences of something, while prevent means to stop something from happening altogether.

For example, if someone eats too much junk food, they can take vitamins to counteract the negative effects on their health.

Counteract is applicable when something has already occurred and you want to lessen its impact, while prevent is applicable when you want to stop something from happening in the first place.

Foil.wordDefinition:
Foil means to stop someone or something from succeeding in their plan or goal by interfering with it.

It is often used when talking about stopping a bad person from doing something harmful. For example, "The superhero foiled the villain's plan to take over the city.".

Foil is used when someone is actively trying to do something bad, and you stop them from doing it. Prevent is used when you want to avoid something bad from happening altogether.

Halt.wordDefinition:
Halt means to stop something that is already in progress, while prevent means to stop something from happening in the first place.

Halt is applicable when we want to put an end to something that has already started or is happening, whereas prevent is suitable when we want to stop something from happening before it happens.

For example, a fire can be halted by extinguishing it with water, whereas a fire can be prevented by avoiding smoking in bed or leaving electrical appliances unattended.

Impede.wordDefinition:
Impede means to slow down or obstruct the progress of something or someone, while prevent means to stop something from happening altogether.

For example, if there is a traffic jam, it might impede your journey and make it slower, but if you take a completely different route to avoid the jam, you prevent it from affecting your journey at all.

Impede refers to slowing progress or making it difficult, while prevent refers to stopping something from happening completely.

Obstruct.wordDefinition:
Obstruct means to block or hinder progress, while prevent means to stop something from happening.

For example, if someone places a barrier in the middle of a road, they are obstructing the path of any cars trying to pass through.

Obstruct is more applicable in situations where there is already progress or movement that is being stopped, while prevent is more applicable in situations where the aim is to stop something from happening altogether.

Stop.wordDefinition:
Prevent means to keep something from happening in the first place, while the word stop means to put an end to something that is already happening.

If you turn off the oven to stop a cake from burning, you are intervening to put an end to a situation that is already in progress.

Prevent is applicable when you want to avoid a situation altogether, while stop is applicable when you need to intervene in a situation that is already happening.

Thwart.wordDefinition:
Prevent means to stop something from happening, while the word thwart means to stop someone or something from achieving their goal.

For example, you can prevent a fire from starting by not leaving the stove on, but you can thwart a burglar's attempt to break into your house by locking the doors and windows.

Prevent is used when referring to stopping something from happening, while thwart is used when referring to stopping someone or something from achieving a specific goal.

videos.Text: Writing down your worries can also help. This strategy may give you a chance to reevaluate a stressful experience, freeing up working memory. And if you have the chance, physical activity, like a brisk walk, deepens breathing and helps relieve muscle tension, preventing anxiety from building. You can also use your knowledge about the brain

But this loss can be prevented through memory consolidation, the process by which information is moved from our fleeting short-term memory to our more durable long-term memory. This consolidation occurs with the help of a major part of the brain, known as the hippocampus.

This is where inhalers, the primary treatment for asthma, come in. These medications help asthmatics both control and prevent their asthma symptoms.

quotes.Text: If you put up a blog, people can cut out the middle man and get material to you. Which is really helpful because a lot of time there's really cool stuff out there that we just don't see. Because, y'know, the agent is acting in our best interest, but it does sometimes prevent some of the good stuff from getting through.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Zach Galligan

quotes.Text: We can prevent many people from becoming terrorists by truly listening to people who feel they've been treated unjustly and responding to their concerns with a sense of justice and compassion.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Coretta Scott King

quotes.Text: There never has been a war yet which, if the facts had been put calmly before the ordinary folk, could not have been prevented. The common man, I think, is the great protection against war.
quotes.Title: British Public Servant
quotes.Name: Ernest Bevin

quotes.Text: My kingdom is not of this world. If it were, my servants would fight to prevent my arrest by the Jews. But now my kingdom is from another place.
quotes.Title: Leader
quotes.Name: Jesus Christ

quotes.Text: We can best help you to prevent war not by repeating your words and following your methods but by finding new words and creating new methods.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Virginia Woolf

quotes.Text: The U.S. and its allies will do anything they can to prevent authentic democracy in the Arab world.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Noam Chomsky

quotes.Text: I think that that's the wisest thing - to prevent illness before we try to cure something.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Maya Angelou

quotes.Text: It's the sad truth that gun violence can often be prevented.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Lucy McBath

quotes.Text: He who does not prevent a crime when he can, encourages it.
quotes.Title: Roman Statesman
quotes.Name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.Text: Don't let making a living prevent you from making a life.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: John Wooden
